Key Arguments: The proposed legislation represents a significant interference with freedom of expression.
The legislation is seen as dystopian and akin to fascism.
The ACMA is not truly independent due to its leadership's affiliations with globalist organizations.
The premise that misinformation and disinformation pose a threat to safety is flawed.
Existing laws of defamation are sufficient to govern speech.
The legislation is viewed as undemocratic and a tool for unelected elites to control citizens.
Censorship during the pandemic was harmful and unnecessary.
The legislation is compared to totalitarian practices and is seen as a threat to democracy.
Notable Quotes: I wholly disagree with the government using social media companies to regulate free speech. It is dystopian in the extreme and is the very definition of fascism.
Free speech is the most important principle of a democracy. Remove it and you do not have a democracy.
This is totalitarianism dressed with a fig leaf that says 'itâ€™s for your safety'.
